DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of two investigational drugs (MK-0736 and MK-0916) in lowering blood pressure and body weight in patients with hypertension (high blood pressure). This is an early phase trial and some specific protocol information is proprietary and not publicly available at this time. (Full information is available to trial participants).
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of MK0736 & MK0916 in Patients With Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)(0736-003)(COMPLETED)
DOC.detailed_description: Participants enrolled in the study will be separated into 2 strata based on baseline body mass index (BMI) assessments prior to being randomly assigned to study treatment. Study will include a 24-week treatment period comprised of 2 phases, A and B, each of which will 12 weeks in duration.
DOC.criteria: Hypertension systolic blood pressure (SBP) </= 160mm Hg and diastolic blood pressure (DBP): 90105mm Hg Premenopausal women patients currently taking more than two (2) blood pressure lowering medications Body Mas Index (BMI)>40 kg/m2 (morbidly obese patients) History of Alcohol abuse (<3 Years) History of diabetes,chronic kidney disease, Active liver disease, recent heart attack or stroke
